intro: Keckia ternata var. septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern keckia, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a distinctive scent when crushed, while its small white or greenish flowers bloom in late spring. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
